title: Listening: which method works best?
description: Making students aware of how they are listening and what makes them choose the correct answer

items.content:
Learning aims:

At the end of this lesson you will be able

1. to identify and use techniques that will help you focus and better understand the text

2. to reflect on your listening outcomes in order to improve your listening skills

You have 30 minutes to do the assignments.

In a few moments you are going to watch an interview with Peter Singer of the animal liberal movement on ethical eating.

What do you think ethical eating implies?

(class discussion)

Vocabulary pre-listening

Discuss the meaning of the words below in your group, then do the exercise.

  • To make your heart sink
  • Nutritious
  • Sustainable
  • Ethical constraints
  • On a par with
  • Prohibited
  • To inflict

Use the (correct form of the) words in the sentences below.

content.body:
1. A balanced and diet is very essential for all of us.

2. food production is a model of farming which aims at producing plant and animal products in ways that are friendly to the environment.

2. This should have been a thriller the Gift, but instead it is totally banal.

3. Using your mobile phone is in class

4. People should have a free choice in eating meat or not, but sometimes there are , especially when eating meat can cause animals to be locked up in narrow spaces that would unnecessarily suffering on them.

5. Knowing that animals are kept in small boxes against their will

items.content: Choose team 1, 2 or 3 according to the group number on your table.

Instructions

1. Go throught the word list and check the meaning of the words.

2. Discuss the words you still don't understand with your group

3. Carefully read the questions for listening and write down difficult words. Discuss them with your group first and then with the teacher. Try to predict what this part of the interview is about (for each question).

4. Watch the video (push the video button) while answering the questions. There is no pause to answer questions, but you may pause the video yourself in between questions and you may listen multiple times.

The questions are also availabe on paper

Video
1. Go through the wordlist below and check the meaning of the words.

2. Discuss the words you still don't understand with your group

3. Carefully read the questions for listening and discuss difficult words with your group. Try to predict what this part of the interview is about (for each question).

4. Watch the video (see video button below) while answering the questions. The video doesn't stop in between to give you time to answer the questions, but you may pause the video yourself if you want to.You may listen twice. The questions are also available on paper.

Video

1. Carefully read the questions and try to predict what this part of the interview is about (for each question).

2. Answer the questions while watching the video (press the video button). NB: there is no pause in between to answer questions.

The questions are also available on paper

Video

1. Compare your answers with your team.

2. Discuss the techniques that were used in your group. Each member has to come up with a technique that he/she used to answer the questions.

Ask for a transcript

3. Each group member reads a question and the matching part of the transcript to the group. Can you figure out what the correct answers are?

4. While reading the transcript, underline the key words. Compare them with key words in the questions and answers. There is an example below.

Here's an example of how to underline the keywords to find the correct answers.

The question is:

So the only logical answer would be: B

Try to to follow the same procedure for the rest of the questions and the transcript

NOW:

5. Decide with your group which technique(s) worked best.

6. Click on the padlet button and upload them.

Padlet

7. Fill in the exit form!! (Don't forget)

For the fastworkers: Choose with your group between the two assignments below:

1. Watch & discuss

Watch the following video by Peter Singer

Ethical issues

He talks about three ethical issues. Which ethical issue is most important according to you and why? Discuss with your group.

2. Write & discuss

Write a 150 words paragraph on your opinion about ethical eating. Discuss with your group.
